Local File Re-generation¶

To avoid having to perform a full build every time the user makes a change to their source, we can re-create some files locally.

This greatly speeds up the development process, and enables offline development in simple situations.

class webmynd.generate.Generate(app_config_file, **kw)[source]¶

Local re-creation of files that are dependent on user code

all(target_dir, user_dir)[source]¶

Re-create all local files in built targets

Parameters:
  • target_dir – the parent directory of the per-platform builds
  • user_dir – the directory holding user’s code
chrome(target_dir, user_dir)[source]¶

Ensure that data.js is in Chome’s customer code directory.

firefox(target_dir, user_dir)[source]¶

Re-create overlay.js for Firefox from source files.

Firefox expects all “privileged” files to be present in one mega-script: we will combine the user-defined files together into one.

Parameters:
  • target_dir – the output directory
  • user_dir – the directory to read the source files from
user(user_dir)[source]¶

Find and replace ${uuid} with the real UUID

Parameters:user_dir – the parent of files to look inside
